snippet: Addiction treatment centers in the borough, which has been hit hard by the opioid epidemic, say they are being offered kickbacks for patient referrals....
abstract: Private, for-profit drug treatment centers across country have begun trying to lure patients from centers in Staten Island, where heroin and painkiller addiction rates are soaring; changes in federal health insurance laws have transformed addiction treatment from local, community-based concern to lucrative and competitive business, giving rise to ethical concerns.
lead_paragraph: Addiction treatment centers in the borough, which has been hit hard by the opioid epidemic, say they are being offered kickbacks for patient referrals.

headline.main: How Staten Island’s Drug Problem Made It a Target for Poaching Patients
headline.print_headline: Poaching Addiction Patients  Amid Borough’s Drug Woes
